sub_title: Vice President - Interntional Centre of Excellence for Innovative Learning
summary:
20+ years’ experience helping Education Institutions achieve/implement their digital transformation journey across EMEA and emerging markets of Asia and Africa. 

UNESCO Co-coordinator of sub-theme: ICT and Distant Learning and Education in Emergencies for International Taskforce on Teachers for Education 2030. 

Since 2013, significantly involved to expand teacher training capacity for refugees and host communities in East Africa and digitalization of basic education delivery in West Africa 2013.

Strong personal network with UNHCR, UNESCO, UNICEF, IGAD Sec. plus education and technology NGOs and government agencies of East Africa. 

Professional and result-driven team leader and motivator of multicultural and multilingual teams and projects.

Extensive footprint advising large educational institutions transition from traditional teaching to technology enhanced learning like “blended learning.” and/or “Personalized learning.”  

Professional and result-driven team leader and motivator of multicultural and multilingual teams and projects.

treasury_media.title: Exploring the use of Artificial Intelligence to support teachers and teacher development
treasury_media.description:
Discussion report from the International Task Force on Teachers for Education 2030’s Mobile Learning Week 2019 Strategy Lab.

June 2019

In an effort to better understand the potential role of Artificial Intelligence (AI) in education, UNESCO Mobile Learning Week 2019 was convened to focus on the role of AI and sustainable development.

treasury_media.title: Challenges of delivering education in emergencies
treasury_media.description: The following articles share some of the inherent challenges we all all face in delivering education outside our established comfort zones.

profile_positions.description:
Windle Netherlands is the fundraising arm of Windle International (WI) (www.windleinternational.org); one of the only international NGOs focusing solely on education for refugees and marginalised communities across eastern Africa.
 
Windle International challenges poverty and inequality by expanding access to and improving the quality of education and training, for communities affected by conflict, displacement, neglect, or discrimination. It is dedicated to reducing inequalities in access to high quality education for these communities, particularly for women and girls.

As Director of Windle International Nederland BV, I support Windle’s development and humanitarian activity through advocacy, fundraising and networking to engage with local and EU and European audiences and inspire those who have the power to strengthen our work and amplify our impact.
profile_positions.title: Director

company.name: International Centre of Excellence For Innovative Learning

profile_positions.company: International Centre of Excellence For Innovative Learning
profile_positions.description:
Co-founded ICEFIL in 2016, it is now an education alliance of 30+ Universities, technology partners and NGOs in North America, Europe and Africa .  ICEFIL brings together international education experts and thought leaders in maximizing use of online, blended or hybrid teaching with personalised and/or competency-based learning to support teachers and teacher training.  

In support of SDG 4 goals for reducing exclusion in basic education especially among refugees and women/girls living in vulnerable communities, ICEFIL is dedicated to advancing use of technology with modern pedagogy and didactics to scale-up formation of teachers for primary, secondary, vocational, and lifelong learning.

In addition to my advocacy against exclusion to basic education in local/international forums, I facilitate one or more consortium members to co-create practical solutions to address the digital transformation challenges faced by teachers today.  

Another priority is to address how technology used with competency-based learning and personalized learning can be a vehicle to find and form new teachers through our second-life for teachers program.
profile_positions.title: Vice President
Coordinator sub-theme 4 - ICT and Distant Education

profile_positions.description:
With annual sales of £5,000,000, GTC is one of the largest training provider of classroom and collaborative online training to key Institutions within Energy, Telecommunications, Financial Services, Universities plus Local/National Governments within the ‘Emerging Markets’ of Asia, Middle East and Africa. 

Role/Achievement: 
I manage a multi-cultural and multi-lingual team of 2 Country Managers, 12 Country Sales Representatives plus 5 Sales and Marketing support staff at HQ.
Met FY2014 revenue target (£5.1 million) despite a difficult year impacted by regional political turbulence, low Oil prices, climate disasters and falling commodity prices in a number of key Emerging Markets of Asia, Middle East and Africa.
profile_positions.title: Commercial Manager

profile_positions.description:
Head of International Sales – Mentorix Aps/Scoll Methods.
Led a Sales team to deliver sales revenues exceeded €1.8Million for fiscal year 2014 selling certificate training, collaborative online eLearning platform and consulting firm selling/delivering within International markets (EMEA and ‘emerging markets’).
profile_positions.title: Head of International Sales

profile_positions.description:
- Managed sales territory: South East of England, France and Switzerland.  
- Exceed individual target of £450,000 gross profit, I also significantly increased our footprint / revenues from key customers in South East UK.
- Exceeded target first year and was on target to surpass target second year despite on-going banking economic crisis.
- Sales leader in two key categories: Average Order Value and Annual Revenue from each key account. 
- New Clients won include: ABSNet, Alexander Forbes, Amphenol, Atkins, Attenda,  BAA, Bond Adapt, Canon, East Kent NHS Trust, EMC, FDM Group, KBR, Kent County Council, Kent Fire & Rescue, KIS Information Systems, KIA Motors, London Borough of Bromley, Mondial Assistance, Novartis, Pension Protection Fund, Pfizer, Philip Morris International, RBS Group, Royal & Sun Alliance, The Structure Group, QinetiQ, Thales UK, Vanquis Bank, Virgin Atlantic among others.
